availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Kentucky soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Ellen Belt. Father of John Belt, Martha Belt, and George Belt. Served in the 48th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as captain from July 15, 1863 to December 16, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Illinois, Hardin County, Cave In Rock, p. 5B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 444.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p.480.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Application #696.469, Certificate #530374.
Find A Grave, "Hiram J. Belt (Sep 15, 1832-Mar 1, 1899)," Memorial #42681027, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/42681027 (accessed July 6, 2020).
